member.name: T:SharpDX.XACT3.AssemblyDoc
member.summary: The assembly provides managed XACT3 API.

summary.p: Runtime parameters for initialization of the XACT engine.

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.AudioEngineSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.AudioEngineSettings.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

summary.dd: Interactive audio and branch event look-ahead time, in milliseconds. This specifies how far ahead the XACT engine will look ahead when determining when to transition to another sound. XACT_ENGINE_LOOKAHEAD_DEFAULT is a good default value to use for this member.

Buffer containing the global file data. This file is generated when you build an XACT project file. It contains category, variable, and RPC information.
Xbox 360
Memory for this member must be allocated using XMemAlloc when specifying the XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA flag.
Windows
Memory for this member must be allocated using CoTaskMemAlloc when specifying the XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA flag.
Size of the data buffer associated with pGlobalSettingsBuffer.

Flag values indicating how global file data should be handled by XACT. This member can be zero or the value shown in the following table.
ValueDescription
XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA
Indicates that XACT should free the buffer pointed to by pGlobalSettingsBuffer when initialization is complete. Note XACT will not attempt to free the memory if the buffer allocation fails. ?

Flag values that indicate the attributes of the memory buffer pointed to by pGlobalSettingsBuffer.
Xbox 360
This member is needed only if XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA is specified in globalSettingsFlags, so that XMemFree can receive the correct values when XACT frees the buffer. Otherwise, globalSettingsAllocAttributes is ignored.
These flags should match the XALLOC_ATTRIBUTES values that were specified to XMemAlloc when the memory buffer pointed to by pGlobalSettingsBuffer was allocated.
Windows
This parameter has no relevance and is ignored.
File I/O callbacks.
Callback that receives notifications.

Pointer to the ID for the audio renderer the engine should connect to.
Xbox 360
This parameter is undefined.
Pointer to the interface used by the engine. If this member is null, the XACT engine will create the XAudio2 object.
Pointer to the interface, representing the mastering voice that should be used by the XACT engine. If pXAudio2 is null, this member must also be null.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.Cue.op_Explicit(System.IntPtr)~SharpDX.XACT3.Cue
member.summary: Performs an explicit conversion from to . (This method is a shortcut to )

returns.p: Returns if successful, an error code otherwise.

param.name: flags
param.dd:
[in] Flag specifying how the cue should be stopped. The flag value may be 0 or the following:
ValueDescription
Indicates the cue should stop immediately, ignoring any release phase or transition specified in the content.?
Note
Specifying a value of 0 causes Stop to account for the release phase and/or transition specified in the XACT.

returns.p: Returns if successful, an error code otherwise.

summary.p: Retrieves the current operating state of a cue.

param.name: stateRef
param.dd:
Flags indicating the state of the cue. The flags are as follows:
ValueDescription
Created, but nothing else?
Preparing to play?
Prepared, but not yet played?
Playing, but can be paused?
Stopping?
Stopped?
Paused?
Note
States represented by these flags are not necessarily mutually exclusive. Therefore, test states using the & (and) operation rather than the == (equals) operation.

returns.p: Returns if successful, an error code otherwise.

remarks.p: This function informs the caller what activity the cue is performing at the moment the call is made. The state returned from GetState indicates only the current condition.

Only is used in combination with other state flags. In other words, the GetState might return a state value with set or set, but never with both (since both conditions cannot both be true at the same time). However, GetState may return a state value with both and flags set, to signify that the cue is paused while playing.

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.Cue.Destroy
member.returns: Returns if successful, an error code otherwise.

remarks.p: will synchronously destroy the cue, stopping the playback immediately, and frees resources allocated for the cue.

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.Cue.SetMatrixCoefficients(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[])

summary.p: Sets the volume level that each source channel of the cue should play in each of its destination channels.

param.name: srcChannelCount
param.dd: [in] Number of source channels. This must equal the number of emitter channels.

param.name: dstChannelCount
param.dd: [in] Number of destination channels. This must equal the number of final mix channels.

param.name: matrixCoefficientsRef
param.dd: [in] Matrix coefficient table. This is an array that represents the volume level of each source channel present in each destination channel. The source channels are the column index and the destination channels are the row index of the table. The table must have at least uSrcChannelCount * uDstChannelCount elements.

returns.p: Returns if successful, an error code otherwise.

remarks.p: The SetMatrixCoefficients method is primarily used for creating the illusion of the cue being played at some position in 3D space. However, it is recommended to use the XACT methods provided for interacting with X3DAudio instead of calling SetMatrixCoefficients directly. The XACT's X3DAudio helper methods handle calculating and applying a cue's matrix coefficients by calling SetMatrixCoefficients. See How To: Integrate X3DAudio with XACT for more information.

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Cue::SetMatrixCoefficients([In] unsigned int uSrcChannelCount,[In] unsigned int uDstChannelCount,[In, Buffer] float* pMatrixCoefficients)

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.Cue.GetVariableIndex(System.String)

summary.p: Retrieves the corresponding index for a variable name string.

param.name: friendlyName
param.dd: [in] String containing the "friendly name" of the variable, as specified in the XACT.

returns.p: The index of the variable if it exists, or XACTVARIABLEINDEX_INVALID otherwise.

member.unmanaged: unsigned short IXACT3Cue::GetVariableIndex([In] const char* szFriendlyName)

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.Cue.SetVariable(System.Int16,System.Single)

summary.p: Stores a new value to a variable, referenced by its index.

param.name: index
param.dd: [in] Assigned index of the variable in which to store nValue.

param.name: value
param.dd: [in] Value to store in the variable.

returns.p: Returns if successful, an error code otherwise.
If the variable is private or read-only, SetVariable returns XACTENGINE_E_INVALIDVARIABLEINDEX.

If nValue falls outside of it's assigned range (or XACTVARIABLEVALUE_MIN to XACTVARIABLEVALUE_MAX), SetVariable returns E_FAIL. In this case, the variable is clamped within valid range and a warning message is sent to the debugger.

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Cue::SetVariable([In] unsigned short nIndex,[In] float nValue)

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.Cue.GetVariable(System.Int16)

summary.p: Retrieves the value of a variable by its index.

param.name: index
param.dd: [in] Assigned index of the variable to retrieve.

returns.dd: [out] Pointer to where to store the value currently held by the variable.

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Cue::GetVariable([In] unsigned short nIndex,[Out] float* nValue)

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.Cue.SetOutputVoiceMatrix(SharpDX.XAudio2.Voice,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[])

summary.p: Sets the volume level of each channel of the final output for the voice. These channels are mapped to the input channels of a specified destination voice.

param.name: destinationVoiceRef
param.dd:
[in] Pointer to a destination for which to set volume levels.
Note
If the voice sends to a single target voice specifying null will cause SetOutputVoiceMatrix to operate on that target voice.

param.name: sourceChannels
param.dd: [in] Confirms the output channel count of the voice. This is the number of channels that are produced by the last effect in the chain.

param.name: destinationChannels
param.dd: [in] Confirms the input channel count of the destination voice.

param.name: levelMatrixRef
param.dd:
[in] Array of [SourceChannels ? DestinationChannels] volume levels sent to the destination voice. The level sent from source channel S to destination channel D is specified in the form pLevelMatrix[SourceChannels ? D + S].
For example, when rendering two-channel stereo input into 5.1 output that is weighted toward the front channels?but is absent from the center and low-frequency channels?the matrix might have the values shown in the following table.
OutputLeft InputRight Input
Left1.00.0
Right0.01.0
Front Center0.00.0
LFE0.00.0
Rear Left0.80.0
Rear Right0.00.8
Note that the left and right input are fully mapped to the output left and right channels; 80 percent of the left and right input is mapped to the rear left and right channels.
See Remarks for more information on volume levels.

returns.p: Returns if successful, an error code otherwise.

remarks.p: Volume levels are expressed as floating-point amplitude multipliers between - and (-224 to 224), with a maximum gain of 144.5 dB. A volume level of 1.0 means there is no attenuation or gain and 0 means silence. Negative levels can be used to invert the audio's phase.

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Cue::SetOutputVoiceMatrix([In, Optional] IXAudio2Voice* pDestinationVoice,[In] unsigned int SourceChannels,[In] unsigned int DestinationChannels,[In, Buffer] const float* pLevelMatrix)

Only is used in combination with other state flags. In other words, the GetState might return a state value with set or set, but never with both (since both conditions cannot both be true at the same time). member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.AudioEngine.GetRendererDetails(System.Int16)

summary.p: Retrieves information about a specific renderer.

td.p: This method is not supported on the Xbox 360 platform.

param.name: rendererIndex
param.dd: Index of the renderer to retrieve information from.

returns.dd: Pointer to an structure that contains details of the renderer.

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Engine::GetRendererDetails([In] unsigned short nRendererIndex,[Out] XACT_RENDERER_DETAILS* pRendererDetails)

param.name: paramsRef
param.dd: [in] Pointer to an structure that contains the XACT engine initialization parameters.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

remarks.p: This function creates the XACT engine and data structures. It should be called in an application only once per instance.

If a title passes an instance of the XAudio2 engine to Initialize and uses auditioning the XAudio2 mastering voice must have a volume meter XAPO attached to it. See XAudio2CreateVolumeMeter for information on creating the volume meter and SetEffectChain for information on attaching the volume meter.

summary.p: Shuts down the XACT engine and frees any resources in use.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

remarks.p: This method destroys all existing cues, sound banks, and wave banks. It blocks until all cues are destroyed. The method also flushes all pending notifications and unregisters all notification descriptions. No XACT API or method calls can be made after calling this function.

summary.p: Performs periodic work that is required by the XACT engine.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

remarks.p: This method drives the XACT engine and is typically called every 30 to 100 milliseconds (about once every one to four frames).

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.AudioEngine.CreateSoundBank(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpDX.XACT3.SoundBank)

summary.p: Creates a sound bank for use by the XACT engine.

param.name: vBufferRef
param.dd:
[in] Pointer to the data that is used to create the sound bank.
Xbox 360
Memory for this member must be allocated by using XMemAlloc when specifying the XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA flag.
Xbox 360 sound banks must be allocated from physical memory (and not the heap). The XALLOC_MEMTYPE_PHYSICAL memory type must be specified as dwMemoryType when memory is allocated through XMemAlloc.
Windows
Memory for this member must be allocated by using CoTaskMemAlloc when specifying the XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA flag.

param.name: size
param.dd: [in] Value that indicates the size of the data that is used to create the sound bank .

param.name: flags
param.dd:
[in] Flag values that indicate how the sound bank is created. This parameter can be zero or the value shown in the following table.
ValueDescription
XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA
Indicates that XACT should free the buffer that the pvBuffer parameter points to, when the sound bank data is released. Note XACT does not attempt to free the memory if the buffer allocation fails. ?

param.name: allocAttributes
param.dd:
[in] Flag values that indicate the attributes of the memory buffer that the pvBuffer parameter points to.
Xbox 360
This parameter is needed only if XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA is specified in dwFlags. This is so that XMemFree can receive the correct values when the XACT frees the buffer. Otherwise, dwAllocAttributes is ignored.
These flags should match the XALLOC_ATTRIBUTES values that were specified to XMemAlloc when the memory buffer that pvBuffer points to was allocated.
Windows
This parameter has no relevance and is ignored.

param.name: soundBankOut
param.dd: [out] Pointer to an object that is returned.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Engine::CreateSoundBank([In] const void* pvBuffer,[In] unsigned int dwSize,[In] unsigned int dwFlags,[In] unsigned int dwAllocAttributes,[Out, Fast] IXACT3SoundBank** ppSoundBank)

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.AudioEngine.CreateInMemoryWaveBank(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpDX.XACT3.WaveBank)

summary.p: Creates an in-memory wave bank for use by the XACT engine.

param.name: vBufferRef
param.dd:
[in] Pointer to the data that is used to create the wave bank.
Xbox 360
Memory for this member must be allocated by using XMemAlloc when you specify the XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA flag.
Xbox 360 wavebanks must be created with caching enabled. The PAGE_WRITECOMBINE and PAGE_NOCACHE flags must not be used when calling XMemAlloc.
Xbox 360 wavebanks must be allocated from physical memory (and not the heap). The XALLOC_MEMTYPE_PHYSICAL memory type must be specified as dwMemoryType when memory is allocated through XMemAlloc.
Windows
Memory for this member must be allocated by using CoTaskMemAlloc when you specify the XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA flag.

param.name: size
param.dd: [in] Value that indicates the size of the data used to create the wave bank.

param.name: flags
param.dd:
[in] Flag values that indicate how the wave bank is created. This parameter can be zero or the value shown in the following table.
ValueDescription
XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA
Indicates that XACT frees the buffer that the pvBuffer parameter points to, when the wave bank data is released. Note XACT does not attempt to free the memory if the buffer allocation fails. ?

param.name: allocAttributes
param.dd:
[in] Flag values that indicate the attributes of the memory buffer that the pvBuffer parameter points to.
Xbox 360
This parameter is needed only if XACT_FLAG_ENGINE_CREATE_MANAGEDATA is specified in dwFlags. This is so that XMemFree can receive the correct values when the XACT engine frees the buffer. Otherwise, dwAllocAttributes is ignored.
These flags should match the XALLOC_ATTRIBUTES values that were specified to XMemAlloc when the memory buffer that pvBuffer points to was allocated.
Windows
This parameter has no relevance and is ignored.

param.name: waveBankOut
param.dd: [out] Pointer to an object that is returned.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Engine::CreateInMemoryWaveBank([In] const void* pvBuffer,[In] unsigned int dwSize,[In] unsigned int dwFlags,[In] unsigned int dwAllocAttributes,[Out, Fast] IXACT3WaveBank** ppWaveBank)

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.AudioEngine.CreateStreamingWaveBank(SharpDX.XACT3.StreamingParameters,SharpDX.XACT3.WaveBank)

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

remarks.p: Do not use a sound that is associated with a streaming wave bank unless you know that the wave bank is prepared.
To ascertain that the wave bank is prepared, do one of the following:

li.p: Create an XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_WAVEBANKPREPARED notification by using .
Issue a query about the state of the wave bank by using . When the XACT_WAVEBANKSTATE_PREPARED bit is set, you can use the wave bank.

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Engine::CreateStreamingWaveBank([In] const XACT_STREAMING_PARAMETERS* pParms,[Out, Fast] IXACT3WaveBank** ppWaveBank)

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.AudioEngine.PrepareWave(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int16,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte,SharpDX.XACT3.Wave)

summary.p: Prepares a wave object from a standard PCM, XMA (Xbox 360) file.

param.name: flags
param.dd:
Flags that affect wave preparation:
ValueDescription
XACT_FLAG_BACKGROUND_MUSICMarks the waves as background music.Xbox 360 This flag is supported only on the Xbox 360 platform. ?
XACT_FLAG_UNITS_MSIndicates that the units passed in are measured in milliseconds.?
XACT_FLAG_UNITS_SAMPLESIndicates that the units passed in are in samples.?

param.name: wavePath
param.dd: Path to the wave file.

param.name: streamingPacketSize
param.dd: Packet Size, in 2 KB increments. If wStreamingPacketSize is 0, the file is an in-memory wave. A fully prepared wave is returned. For streaming waves, the client needs to call to ensure that the wave is prepared before playback. Loop region information is read from the wave file.

param.name: alignment
param.dd: Alignment of wave data on the media from which it is streamed. This must be at least 2048. Otherwise, it must be a multiple of 2048.

param.name: playOffset
param.dd: Play offset to use as the start of the wave. The offset can be described in milliseconds or in samples. The dwFlags argument determines the offset units.

param.name: loopCount
param.dd: Number of times to loop the file. If there is no loop region, and the loop count is nonzero, the entire wave is looped.

param.name: waveOut
param.dd: Pointer to an object that is returned.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

remarks.p: If this API is used to prepare XMA content, the content must be encoded by using 64K block size.
PrepareWave does not support xWMA. xWMA content can be prepared using one of the following methods:

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Engine::PrepareWave([In] unsigned int dwFlags,[In] const char* szWavePath,[In] unsigned short wStreamingPacketSize,[In] unsigned int dwAlignment,[In] unsigned int dwPlayOffset,[In] unsigned char nLoopCount,[Out, Fast] IXACT3Wave** ppWave)

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.AudioEngine.PrepareInMemoryWave(System.Int32,SharpDX.XACT3.WaveBankEntry,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Byte},System.Int32,System.Byte,SharpDX.XACT3.Wave)

summary.p: Creates an in-memory object from data that is already resident in memory.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

remarks.p: The application must make sure that the any buffers passed in (data, seek table) are valid through the lifetime of this wave.

td.p: If this API is used to prepare XMA content, the content must be encoded with 64K block size. When using XMAEncode, specify "/b 64" on the command line to create 64K blocks.

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Engine::PrepareInMemoryWave([In] unsigned int dwFlags,[In] WAVEBANKENTRY entry,[In, Optional] unsigned int* pdwSeekTable,[In, Optional] unsigned char* pbWaveData,[In] unsigned int dwPlayOffset,[In] unsigned char nLoopCount,[Out, Fast] IXACT3Wave** ppWave)

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.AudioEngine.PrepareStreamingWave(System.Int32,SharpDX.XACT3.WaveBankEntry,SharpDX.XACT3.StreamingParameters,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Int32,System.Byte,SharpDX.XACT3.Wave)

summary.p: Creates a streaming wave object for the file handle that is passed in.

param.name: flags
param.dd:
Flags that affect wave preparation:
ValueDescription
XACT_FLAG_BACKGROUND_MUSICMarks the waves as background music. Xbox 360 This flag is supported only on the Xbox 360 platform.?
XACT_FLAG_UNITS_MSIndicates that the units passed in are measured in milliseconds.?
XACT_FLAG_UNITS_SAMPLESIndicates that the units passed in are in samples.?

param.name: entry
param.dd: structure that describes the format, play region, and loop region for the wave.

param.name: streamingParams
param.dd: structure with a valid file handle, packet size, etc.

param.name: alignment
param.dd: Alignment of wave data on the media from which it is streamed. This must be at least 2048. Otherwise, it must be a multiple of 2048.

param.name: seekTableRef
param.dd: The seek table for XMA content. The first DWORD must be the count of entries in the table that follows it.

param.name: playOffset
param.dd: Play offset to use as the start of the wave. The offset can be described in milliseconds or in samples. The dwFlags argument determines the offset units.

param.name: loopCount
param.dd: Loop count for the wave.

param.name: waveOut
param.dd: Pointer an object that is returned.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

remarks.p: If this API is used to prepare XMA content, the content must be encoded with 64K block size. ADPCM files are currently not supported.

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Engine::PrepareStreamingWave([In] unsigned int dwFlags,[In] WAVEBANKENTRY entry,[In] XACT_STREAMING_PARAMETERS streamingParams,[In] unsigned int dwAlignment,[In, Optional] unsigned int* pdwSeekTable,[In] unsigned int dwPlayOffset,[In] unsigned char nLoopCount,[Out, Fast] IXACT3Wave** ppWave)

summary.p: Sets the volume of a sound category.

param.name: category
param.dd: [in] Index of the category (XACTCATEGORY) for which to set the volume, as returned by .

param.name: volume
param.dd: [in] Volume level to set.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

remarks.p: The volume is a floating point scale where 0.0 means -96db, 1.0 means 0db, and 2.0 means +6db.

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.AudioEngine.Pause(System.Int16,SharpDX.Bool)

summary.p: Pauses or resumes playback of a category.

param.name: category
param.dd: [in] Index of the category (XACTCATEGORY) to pause, as returned by .

param.name: pause
param.dd: [in] Action to take. If TRUE, playback is paused. If , playback resumes.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

remarks.p: A stopping or stopped cue cannot be paused.

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Engine::Pause([In] unsigned short nCategory,[In] BOOL fPause)

param.name: cueIndex
param.dd:
[in] Index of the cue to be stopped.
Note
All instances of the cue that are specified by nCueIndex are stopped.

param.name: flags
param.dd:
[in] Flags affecting how the cue will be stopped. By default, the sound completes the release phase that the content has set up.
ValueDescription
XACT_FLAG_SOUNDBANK_STOP_IMMEDIATECue stops immediately. It ignores any release phase or transition that is specified in the content.?

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

summary.p: Sets the volume value for each output of a wave.

remarks.p: The final output volume of any channel is the matrix coefficient volume multiplied by the value that is specified by .

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.Wave.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.Wave.op_Explicit(System.IntPtr)~SharpDX.XACT3.Wave
member.summary: Performs an explicit conversion from to . (This method is a shortcut to )

param.name: flags
param.dd:
Flags that affect how the wave is stopped:
ValueDescription
XACT_FLAG_STOP_RELEASEPlays the wave to completion, then stops. For looping waves, this flag plays the current iteration to completion, then stops (ignoring any subsequent iterations). In either case, any release or tail is played. To stop the wave immediately, use the XACT_FLAG_STOP_IMMEDIATE flag.?
XACT_FLAG_STOP_IMMEDIATEStops the playback immediately.?

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

summary.p: Returns the state of the wave object.

param.name: stateRef
param.dd:
Pointer to a DWORD that receives the current wave state.
ValueDescription
XACT_STATE_CREATEDCreated, but nothing else.?
XACT_STATE_PREPARINGIn the middle of preparing.?
XACT_STATE_PREPAREDPrepared, but not yet played.?
XACT_STATE_PLAYINGPlaying, but can be paused.?
XACT_STATE_STOPPINGStopping.?
XACT_STATE_STOPPEDStopped.?
XACT_STATE_PAUSEDPaused. Can be combined with some of the other state flags.?
XACT_STATE_INUSEObject is in use. Used by wave banks and sound banks.?
XACT_STATE_PREPAREFAILEDObject preparation failed.?

returns.p: Returns if successful. If unsuccessful, an error code is returned.

summary.p: Sets the pitch of a wave.

param.name: pitch
param.dd: XACTPITCH value that is used to set the pitch for playback of this wave.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

remarks.p: The value of pitch may be between XACTPITCH_MIN (-1200) and XACTPITCH_MAX (1200), which is approximately one semitone.

summary.p: Sets the volume of a wave.

param.name: volume
param.dd: XACTVOLUME value that is used to set the volume for playback of this wave.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

member.name: M:SharpDX.XACT3.Wave.SetMatrixCoefficients(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[])

summary.p: Sets the volume value for each output of a wave.

param.name: srcChannelCount
param.dd: Number of source channels.

param.name: dstChannelCount
param.dd: Number of destination channels.

param.name: matrixCoefficientsRef
param.dd: Matrix coefficient table. This is an array that represents the volume level of each source channel that is present in each destination channel. The source channels are represented by the column index of the table. The destination channels are represented by the row index of the table. The table must have at least uSrcChannelCount?uDstChannelCount elements.

returns.p: Returns if successful. Otherwise, an error code.

remarks.p: The final output volume of any channel is the matrix coefficient volume multiplied by the value that is specified by .

member.unmanaged: HRESULT IXACT3Wave::SetMatrixCoefficients([In] unsigned int uSrcChannelCount,[In] unsigned int uDstChannelCount,[In, Buffer] float* pMatrixCoefficients)

summary.p: Starts the playback for a wave that is indicated by the wave index.

param.dd: Index of the wave.

param.name: flags
param.dd:
Flags that affect wave preparation:
ValueDescription
XACT_FLAG_BACKGROUND_MUSICMarks the waves as background music.Xbox 360 This flag is supported only on the Xbox 360 platform.?
XACT_FLAG_UNITS_MSIndicates that the units that are passed in are measured in milliseconds.?
XACT_FLAG_UNITS_SAMPLESIndicates that the units that are passed in are in samples.?

param.name: playOffset
param.dd: Play offset to use as the start of the wave. The offset can be described in milliseconds or in samples. The dwFlags argument determines the offset units.

param.name: loopCount
param.dd: Number of loops for playback.

returns.dd: Pointer to an object that is returned.

summary.p: Reports cue properties back to the client.

remarks.p: This structure returns the non-instance specific cue properties for a cue. That is, it returns the properties shared across all instances of a cue.

summary.dd: Friendly name of the cue. If the sound bank does not contain the friendly names, an empty string is returned.
TRUE if the cue is an interactive audio cue and otherwise.
For interactive audio cues, the index of the variable to control the cue.
Number of sound variations for this cue.
Maximum number of instances that are allowed for this cue.
Number of currently active instances of this cue.
Pointer to the client (title) implementation of the XACT_READFILE_CALLBACK callback function.
Pointer to the client (title) implementation of the XACT_GETOVERLAPPEDRESULT_CALLBACK callback function.

summary.p: Notification structure for all XACT cue notifications.

summary.dd: Cue index. XACTINDEX_INVALID signifies an invalid cue index.
Pointer to the instance. This reference is invalid when the notification type is XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_CUEDESTROYED.
Pointer to the instance. This reference is invalid when the notification type is XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_CUEDESTROYED.

summary.p: Provides descriptions for registering, unregistering, and flushing notifications.

summary.dd:
Notification type. Can be one of the following values:
Value Supported Fields
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_CUEPREPARED None, sound bank, sound bank and cue index, cue instance
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_CUEPLAY None, sound bank, sound bank and cue index, cue instance
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_CUESTOP None, sound bank, sound bank and cue index, cue instance
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_CUEDESTROYED None, sound bank, sound bank and cue index, cue instance
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_MARKER None, sound bank, sound bank and cue index, cue instance
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_SOUNDBANKDESTROYED None, sound bank
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_WAVEBANKDESTROYED None, wave bank
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_LOCALVARIABLECHANGED None, sound bank, sound bank and cue index, cue instance
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_GLOBALVARIABLECHANGED None
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_GUICONNECTED None
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_GUIDISCONNECTED None
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_WAVEPREPARED None, wave bank and wave index, wave instance
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_WAVEPLAY None, sound bank, sound bank and cue index, cue instance, wave bank
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_WAVESTOP None, sound bank, sound bank and cue index, cue instance, wave bank
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_WAVELOOPED None, sound bank, sound bank and cue index, cue instance, wave bank, wave instance
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_WAVEDESTROYED None, wave bank and wave index, wave instance
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_WAVEBANKPREPARED None, wave bank
XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_WAVEBANKSTREAMING_INVALIDCONTENT None, wave bank

Flag that describes the notification behavior. Can be 0 or the following:
ValueDescription
XACT_FLAG_NOTIFICATION_PERSISTSets the notification to persist. If this flag is not set, the user receives no more than one notification of the type registered.?
Pointer to the instance. If this entry is set to null, the notification applies to all sound banks.
Pointer to the instance (optional). This entry can be null, if no wave bank applies.
Pointer to the instance (optional). This entry can be null, if no cue applies.
Pointer to the instance (optional). The entry can be null, if no wave applies.
Cue index. If pSoundBank is null, this entry should contain the value XACTINDEX_INVALID.
Wave index.
User context (optional). The entry can be null, if no user context applies.

summary.p: Notification structure for all GUI notifications.

summary.dd: Reserved for future use.

summary.p: Notification structure for all marker notifications.

summary.dd: Cue index. XACTINDEX_INVALID signifies an invalid cue index.
Pointer to the instance.
Pointer to the instance.
The ID of the marker.

summary.p: Notification structure for all sound bank notifications.

summary.dd: Pointer to the instance. This reference is invalid when the notification type is XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_SOUNDBANKDESTROYED.

summary.p: Notification structure for all variable notifications.

summary.dd: Cue index.
Soundbank instance.
Cue instance.
Variable index.
Variable value.
TRUE if a local variable.

summary.p: Notification structure for all wave notifications.

summary.dd: Pointer to the instance.
Wave index.
Cue index. XACTINDEX_INVALID signifies an invalid cue index.
Pointer to the instance.
Pointer to the instance.
Pointer to the instance.

summary.p: Notification structure for all wave bank notifications.

summary.dd: Pointer to the instance. This reference is invalid when the notification type is XACTNOTIFICATIONTYPE_WAVEBANKDESTROYED.

summary.p: Returns information about a particular renderer.

summary.dd: Wide character array containing the id of the renderer.

Wide character array that contains the name of the renderer.
Note
The friendly name is useful in presenting the audio devices that are available to the end user. However, the renderer id can be passed in the structure?which is used during XACT initialization?to connect to the renderer.
TRUE if this renderer is the default renderer. Otherwise, .

summary.p: Returns the properties for a sound that is referenced by the active variation.

remarks.p: The following is an example of iterating through the track properties represented by the arrTrackProperties member:

summary.dd: Category that this sound belongs to.
Priority that is assigned to this sound.
Current pitch of the sound.
Current volume of the sound.

summary.p: Returns the properties of the sound variation that is currently active in a cue instance.

summary.dd: Properties of the currently active variation, represented by an structure.
Properties of the sound that the active variation references, represented by an structure.

summary.p: Streaming parameters for a wave bank.

remarks.p: Xact.h also includes the following constant declaration:

summary.dd:
File handle that is associated with the wave bank data.
Windows
The file that is referenced by this handle must be opened with the following CreateFile flags: FILE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED | FILE_FLAG_NO_BUFFERING.
Offset in the wave bank data file. This offset must be DVD sector aligned.
Flags. Reserved for future use. Set to 0.

Stream packet size, in sectors, to use for each stream. The minimum value is 2.
The size of a DVD sector is 2048 bytes. Therefore, setting this value to 2 results in a packet size of 4096 bytes. Setting it to 3 specifies packets of 6144 bytes, setting it to 4 specifies packets of 8192 bytes, and so on.
The optimal DVD size is a multiple of 16 (1 DVD block = 16 DVD sectors).

summary.p: Returns the properties of a track in an active sound variation in a cue instance.

remarks.p: These properties are timing dependent. They may change when the call returns.

summary.dd: Duration of the track in milliseconds.
Total number of wave variations in the track.
Maximum number of channels that are required to play the track.
Index of the currently active wave variation.
Current loop count on the track.

summary.p: Returns the properties for the variation that is currently active in a cue instance.

summary.dd: Index of the variation in the parent variation list.
Weight that is assigned to the variation. This member is used by noninteractive variations only.
Lower bound of the interactive variable that controls the variation. This member is used by interactive variations only.
Upper bound of the interactive variable that controls the variation. This member is used by interactive variations only.
Flag that indicates if the variation should linger. This member is used by interactive variations only.

summary.p: Contains the entry information from an XACT wave bank.

dd.p: DWORD value representing both the flags and duration.

summary.dd: structure describing the mini-wave format for the wave bank entry.
structure that describes the region within the wave data segment that contains this entry.
structure that describes the region within the wave data (in samples) that should loop.

dd.p: Flags for the wave bank entry. Can be the following values.

tr.td: Indicates one or more looping sounds use this wave.?
Indicates removal of data after the end of the loop region.?

dd.p: Duration of the wave, in units of one sample. For instance, a ten second long wave sampled at 48KHz would have a duration of 480,000. This value is not affected by the number of channels, the number of bits per sample, or the compression format of the wave.

summary.p: Contains the header information from an XACT wave bank.

summary.dd: File signature. In a valid file, this will equal WAVEBANK_HEADER_SIGNATURE.
Version of the tool that created the file. The version is XACT_CONTENT_VERSION, and is defined in XACT.h.
Version of the wave bank file format. The current file format version is WAVEBANK_HEADER_VERSION.
Array of structures representing the segment lookup table. The indices into this array are defined in . For example, you would use the index to find the bank data region.

summary.p: Contains the mini-wave format for an XACT wave bank.

summary.dd: This member is unused.

dd.p: Format of the wave file. Can be one of the values in the following table.
Number of channels in the wave file. Can be a value from 1 to 6.
Sampling rate of the wave file or sample rate of the decoded audio for compressed formats.
Block alignment index. For xWMA the lower 6 bits are the block alignment index and the upper 2 bits are the bytes per second index.
Bit depth of the wave file. Can be one of the values in the following table.
For xWMA this field indicates whether the format is in the WMA format (0) or the WMA Pro format (1).

summary.p: Contains the region information for an XACT wave bank.

summary.dd: Region offset in bytes.
Region length in bytes.

summary.p: Returns the properties that are common to all waves.

summary.dd: Friendly name for the wave. An empty string if the wave bank has been stripped of friendly names.
Format for the wave.
Duration of the wave, in samples.
Loop region that is defined in samples.
TRUE if the wave is streaming. Otherwise, .

member.name: T:SharpDX.XACT3.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace provides a managed XACT3 API.

member.name: T:SharpDX.XACT3.RawNotification
member.summary: Hand written version of XACT_NOTIFICATION in order to smoothly support compatible x86/x64 inner anonymous union.
